Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Hillary677
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in August 2011. It's tiny, the rooms are tiny, the location is great. The bathroom was smaller than bathrooms on cruise ships... come to think of it the room was smaller than cruise ship cabins. The breakfast is adequate & very tiny. Well... it's NYC, you get the picture. We had room 602 with 3 twin beds. The beds were hard than preferred, but not horrible. The staff was nice... oh and the elevators were (you guessed it) tiny. We had a AAA discount and for this area of Manhattan, including breakfast, this Comfort Inn was truly a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice clean new York hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcsowden
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a school trip in april 2010. I stayed for a week here and the rooms were great. Their single bed was a double and there were great room facilities. The foods was not great here. You got a good continental breakfast in polystyrene dishes in a cramped area, but it is new York so there is plenty of places to go visit. So I would highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, but small.”
Reviews.Author: MadMorf
Reviews.Content: Four of us in NYC for the Holidays. Only place we could find with a 3 bed suite. Price is not bad, for NYC, the rooms are tiny though. Complementary breakfast is decent and the coffee is good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid for the Price”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromVA188
Reviews.Content: This is an smallish (maybe 10 stories), older hotel that appears to have been redone and rebranded as a Comfort Inn. We had a room on front of the building with a view of the top of Empire State building. Of course room was small, but clean and well stocked. We were shopping, eating and sightseeing hard all weekend, so didn't spend much time in the room. Perfect for our purposes. Got a good AAA rate for 1 king size bed during expensive holiday season ($242). Ate breakfast out - too many awesome options to waste time with cold cereal and a dry mini muffin. Really had no interaction with staff other than quick check in and checking baggage with concierge after check out while we did a little extra sightseeing before leaving town. But those were both pleasant. Subway is nearby and many lines stop at 23rd St. Eataly (italian market/food court/coffee bar) is close and a must stop, as is the Shake Shack in nearby Madison Square Park. We usually try to book a moderately priced hotel through applecorehotels.com (Hotel @ Times Square being our favorite of those) but they were all full and this hotel is similar and almost as good.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Lexilou_10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea. Three mornings out of four there was no hot water, had to ask for towels as room service forgot to replace them when the room was cleaned.The room and reception needed a good dust as you could write your name on the dust that had settled. Out of the three reception staff only one was helpful, in fact the others were surly.

Reviews.Title: “You could do worse in NY”
Reviews.Author: lonereignger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times when all other hotels were full. It has some really nice rooms in the front of the hotel, and has some horrible rooms in the back and center of the air shaft rooms that feel and look like a prison cell, only darker. The free breakfast is packed most time so best to get there early to get a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Old Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Virginia1946
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of this hotel I wasn't sure what to expect upon arrival. We was very pleasantly surprised when we got there. Although the room is small, especially the bathroom, it was well-decorated and clean. We had a king-sized bed which was very comfortable. We didn't have the best room in the house by any means. We had no view from the window except for another building directly across the courtyard. However, the hotel itself was well-maintained and had a lot of character. The original ceilings in the lobby had just been repainted and looked terrific. There was a small sitting area in the lobby with decent furniture. They were renovating the breakfast room to make it larger. Breakfast was the usual Comfort Inn fare. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is practically at the corner of 25th Street and Broadway. Only two minutes at most to the subway and the subway line took you either all the way up to Central Park or all the way down to the Battery without having to change trains. Very convenient. The hotel is only 5 minutes away from Macy's and the Empire State Building and a 15 minute walk at most to Times Square. All-in-all a very well-located, convenient place to stay in New York. There were a number of restaurants nearby. We ate at a place called Rogues on 6th Avenue which was reasonably priced and had good food. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a more reasonable place to stay in New York. Times Square hotels are so expensive! We paid $242 a night for 3 nights which isn't bad by NY standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: princesspp01
Reviews.Content: We were placed in this hotel as booked a holiday inn hotel that was not ready for our arrival. This hotel is a great location for NYC. We arrived after a delayed flight etc, check in was simple and quick then up to our rooms (two couples travelling), we were on the sixth floor. No view from the window apart from other rooms but that didnt bother me as I wasnt planning on spending any time in the room apart from sleeping/changing etc. Room wasnt the biggest but enough room for two adults to be comfortable, was cleaned daily and was very clean. They also offered breakfast in the price which was good to grab something or even tea/coffee before heading out. Would stay here again for the price and location in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joanieCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights recently in the two room one bathroom suite(5 women). The rooms were small but clean and beds were quite comfortable.-view of Empire State building was a bonus. The room was quiet and we even saw a Serbian wedding in the church across the street. We could walk or take subway or taxi to anyplace we wanted to go. The breakfast was good and had lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Comfort Inn We Have Stayed In.”
Reviews.Author: NZ_NURSE
Reviews.Content: Had this hotel booked by our travel agents wholesaler after our original hotel had closed for renovation. Sadly this hotel was not up to the standard of other Comfort Inns I have stayed in. From the time I walked in I was unimpressed. We were on the top floor in a pokey little side room. We couldn't open the door fully as it hit the end of the bed. It was very noisy at night and also very hot, with an inadequate air conditioner. The breakfast room was like a college dorm room with paper plates and cups. There were 2 very slow elevators. One of them was so old you had to pull open a heavy manual door to step in. The front desk staff very not very helpful when we asked for directions to some of the most important buildings in New York. It was quite a walk to find descent restaurants open close by. All in all we did not enjoy our stay at this Comfort Inn and can only thank goodness it was only for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: katy-lied
Reviews.Content: It's not the fanciest of hotels , rooms are quite small and the clientele appeared to be school tour groups. Front desk staff were professional and friendly but the location is perfect - located on uptown/downtown bus routes between 5th/6th avenues and well served by subway. The street itself is quite dark at night but overall in a great location for the budget minded traveller to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: staples1958
Reviews.Content: We went with 4 people and had 2 separate rooms. Simple but decent breakfast. Very nice location. Small but clean bathroom. 20 minute walk from Times square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for our NYC "Mini-Moon"”
Reviews.Author: piernikm
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were married in May (21st) & for his wedding gift I bought him Yankees tix & booked us weekender to NYC. I booked this hotel because of its location & good price. I didn't want to spend a lot for a room knowing we wouldn't be in it all that much. This hotel was PERFECT! Comfy beds, nice bathrooms, & a great view of the Empire State Building. There's free wi-fi, as well as a nice hot breakfast every morning & boy do they put our a good spread!! It's close to the subways (which is how we got around all weekend). The front desk told us to try the "shop behind the hotel" for food/beer. It was an amazing market (pic attached) that was a great tip. I'd definately return to this hotel when we return. It was a great value & very clean. Kinda small rooms, but thats expectated in big cities. Great Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: klocco1
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably Disappointed I arrived at the hotel at around 3:00pm on July 28th. I was put off first of all by the make shift ramp right in the middle of the steps leading into the hotel. I understand the need to handicapped accessibility but this was a hazard to persons without a challenge to walk. Checked in without any problems, and was given room 705. I realized quickly that the hotel elevator(s) were slow and non-responsive and it was easier to take the steps, which I did. The elevator, when I did use it was more like a broom closet and hot! When I got off the elevator, I was met with a vacuum cleaner and a huge garbage bag full of trash. I litterally had to step over them and move the vacuum. I winded my way to Room 705 which was in the back of the hotel which was quiet, thankfully. Two double beds in a very small room and a regular bathroom. The trouble started when I tried to take a shower. NO HOT WATER. I was in a hurry to meet people for dinner, so hurriedly took a wash cloth but informed the front desk that the hot water did not work in my room. The woman at the front desk replied to my concern with “No one else has complained.”! Are you kidding me? I told them I couldn’t go with the maintenance person at that time, but would check with them when I returned. When I returned, I used my key card and it didn’t work, so down the steps I go to the front desk. They gave me a new key card and told me that my hot water problem was fixed. Back up to the room I go, start the shower, get ready and low and behold, NO HOT WATER. The only thing hot in that room was me!!!! I called the front desk and they sent some up, and long story short, I moved to another room directly next door. But this time, I knew I would only be staying one night. I checked out of the Comfort Inn Chelsea that next morning and went back to the W Hotel Union Square! This is what I get for trying to save a little bit of cash. If you don’t mind 1) Slow and non-working elevators 2) No hot water, or a chance of 3) Rude check in and checkout people 4) Your concerns not being met 5) No wireless working (and you must pay when it does work) Then definitely stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is conveniently located on 25th Street right off of Broadway, and the N Q and R Uptown and downtown trains are a block or 2 away which is nice. This is probably the only thing that is going for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK because we used Choice Privilege points”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelers48
Reviews.Content: I would not have been particularly pleased had I paid New York City prices for this room, rather than using points. The room itself was fine - small, but clean. There was also a free breakfast included, which looked OK. However, we did not take advantage of it since we were going to have our breakfast with our daughter who lives in Chelsea. Location was perfect for that, being only a few blocks from my daughter's apartment. Location of hotel was also across the street from a small flea market (Sunday mornings?) and on the same street with some antique/flea market shops. It is convenient to Chelsea Market and High Line park. I was glad that our room was on the third floor because the elevator was either very slow - or, at times, not working at all. Finally, I was disappointed because I left my pjs hanging on the back of the bathroom door and when I called to inquire about them, nobody knew anything.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: hllindsay
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our trip to NYC, and I had to write this review. This hotel was great!!!! Great price, clean, great staff, the view out our window was AMAZING!!!!!! Ask for a room on the front of the hotel. It is centrally located, and not more than a $15 taxi drive to about anywhere. The breakfast was way more than I expected. Fill up, and you don't need to eat again till dinner!!!! would I recommend it.....already have, and will again!!!! Would I stay again?? You betcha!!! Bottom line......great price.....small room, but not too small...great location......great staff.......don't hesitate....go for it!!! And many many thanks to Sherry!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Price”
Reviews.Author: NZnpfamily_5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and three teenagers. Was good value for money. Greta location and the breakfast was good. Would stay there again.Friendly helpful staff - My husband accidentally left a shirt in the wardrobe and they found it and put it aside for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good family room, good location”
Reviews.Author: plustips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea for 2 nights in February. We were delayed arriving due to blizzards and I called from LA to let them know. There were absolutely no problems with our late arrival (midnight) and our room was ready. We had a family room which suited us and our teenagers perfectly. The location was great. Close to subways which we used to travel all around Manhattan. Breakfast is basic but fine for us. Got wrong directions from tour staff which was the only bad thing as it caused us to miss our flight. Delta rescheduled for us with no charge thank goodness. If you want good basic and safe accomodation for a family of 4, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tyro2
Reviews.Content: great location with average looking rooms. good value for money. only criticism was the saggy bed. noise was not an issue although they provided ear plugs. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, convenient location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: kvealg8r
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I spent two nights here in one of the 3-twin bed rooms on the 10th floor (#1002). The room had a front facing view of the church across the street and various buildings, but not of Empire State Building. The room was very small and dated, but was clean and the twin beds were comfortable. We didn't plan to spend much time in the room so we didn't mind it at all. There was street noise as well as the noise of opening/closing doors on our floor, but the hum of the A/C unit drowned it out a little. Registration and concierge employees were helpful. Free wifi was easy to use. We did not eat free breakfast here. Hotel is close to Flatiron Building and 23rd Street Subway station with easy access to Central Park, Times Square, Chinatown, Staten Island Ferry on the R Line. For the price and location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: TravelEurope87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here alone last year. Was conveniently located for tourists, close to metro station and can walk to most attractions (even central park). Room was big enough for me, possible not had there been two people to the room. Clean, has a safe, free wi-fi connection. Breakfast was good, lots of variety, small dining area so can imagine it being busy in peak season. reception staff were very helpful and helped organise taxi journeys to airport and gave me maps etc. Street quite dark of a night, but wasn't a real issue. Has shops and restaurants located close by. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abc12347
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chelsea Comfort Inn for ten nights as part of a school trip, and was quite happily surprised at my surroundings, the hotel was clean and everything you would need in a hotel. I stayed in a room with five other girls and as you can imagine it became quite messy, nether the less the cleaners still made our beds every day and we had clean towels every day. Although being on the tenth floor i suggest you do not walk up the very narrow staircase, especially with suitcase like we had too! The breakfast had a varied choice although the breakfast area could get quite cramped and busy with no real system. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Austin92024
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 day here, rooms are dirty, staff is rude, and beds have bed bugs. Don't stay here, you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjs3454
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in March and found the location excellent. Not too far away from the bus or train station for airport connections, and very central. The Flatiron building is just feet away and the Empire State building is well within walking distance. Time Square is just under 20 blocks away and only took about 15-20 minutes to walk. There are several subway stations very close by and these were very useful for getting around. Also several shops and restaurants. The bus stop for the 'hop-on hop-off' sightseeing buses is next to the Flatiron building so is within easy reach. The hotel itself is nothing special, room fairly small and the furnishings were quite outdated, but it had everything we needed. The staff were helpful, on one occasion our safe stopped working so we spoke to the front desk staff who arranged for it to be fixed within minutes. They also offered an airport transfer bus for $24 each, but we had already arranged to take the bus to Newark so didn't make use of this. The hotel was fairly quiet at night, except for a few slammed doors! No view from the room, but we didn't spend a huge amount of time inside it so this was no problem. It did offer free wi-fi which was a nice bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel -Would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Floss97
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely rude, the room was dimly lit. The linens were old and ragged. The "concierge" did not speak engligh, charged $1 per bag, cash only, then made me carry the bag down to the storage room. The breakfast selection was terrible, you had to beg for refills. I ended up leaving and eating elsewhere. The business center was a pay as you go internet connection. This one occassion, the hotel had 50+ teenagers running around slamming doors including the heavy fire door all night. I called the desk several times, no action was taken.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: eb4eva
Reviews.Content: horrible hotel staff. treated me with a disgusting & demeaning attitude. THEY WILL NOT ONLY BE REPORTED TO CHOICE (and I'm elite diamond), but I WILL NEVER, EVER GO NEAR THIS HOTEL AGAIN. I left saying my stay was "just ok." I would rather report them to their franchise than deal with them as they clearly don't care about their guests. Ironically, their horrible way of manging this hotel and dealing with guests surely has got to hurt their business. Treating your guests with respect makes them want to return and spend more $$$$$$$$ duh!!! I cannot recommend this hotel based on my experience here. Their rooms are disgusting and have bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but clean and good location wise for exploring the Village”
Reviews.Author: Ireaisling79
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn is old on the inside but the room I stayed in was clean but very small. It served its purpose for my stay. The parking garage was not right next door but a short walk away. It was perfectly located for myself in wanting to explore more of the Chelsea/Greenwich Village area. There are no real frills to this hotel but it was clean, centrally located, and had a small but decent continental breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the rat hole!”
Reviews.Author: zen06
Reviews.Content: Room is clean, but rooms are very very small, no luxury. Breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE TO SLEEP IN”
Reviews.Author: davidchien
Reviews.Content: When I booked, I am not sure. Well, it is clean and nice surroundings. Room is clean. A lot of fun places nearby for you to go. If you want to have a drink, good places are available. I slept well. If you have someone to go with you, I think she or he will like this place too. And also new York city has a lot of places for you to visit. This is a nice place to sleep in. I did not use other stuff in this hotel or inn. But I am sure it is good though. Well, all in all, this was my trip, what you will have counts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for women solo business travelors”
Reviews.Author: NancyA5
Reviews.Content: I travel on business all the time and my "regular" NYC hotel was sold out so I tried this one. Great location - can walk to restaurants and I felt very safe all the time. Courteous staff. In the morning, there were lots of European travelors at the breakfeast table and they were a bit crabby but overall, great place. I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old building, well located, not so clean...”
Reviews.Author: RCOLLOR
Reviews.Content: Well located in the center of NY, next to Madison Square Park, 5th Avenue, Broadway. Very near to a Bestbuy and Macy´s, Starbucks and other restaurants. CVS pharmacy on the corner of the street. On the week-end there is a flee market right in front of the hotel. Nearby antique shops are very good too. The staff speaks poor english (they are 90% indians - from India). The front desk clerks are helpful and educated. Shower is good and air-conditioning works just fine. They have TV and minibar (empty) in the rooms. Soda/water/ice machines are located in the lobby. Staff will not help with the luggage, not even for a good tip...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, inexpensive and clean”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine19464
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Comfort Inn with a friend. The good points: location, free breakfast, friendly staff, coffee in the room. Drawbacks: very small room with 2 single beds, desk (but you could not sit in the chair as there was no room to pull it out from under the desk), no where to sit outside the hotel (but I guess that's common in NYC) so when you're at the hotel you're stuck in this very small area. The windows were filthy. No view. Air conditioner was noisy. Very narrow hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most luxurious, but good enough!”
Reviews.Author: xGrendelx
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here if you're looking for an elegant night in Manhattan in a super nice hotel. I would, however, stay here if you all you're really looking for is a comfy bed in a safe and accessible location. The hotel itself were a bit small, but I was okay with that. Also, they was no central A/C but we did have a single unit in the room that was more than efficient. The location, although more Flatiron than Chelsea, was perfect for us. Only a few block from the nearest subway stop and within walking distance to the Flatiron Building, Empire State, and NY Public Library. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs sucked our blood”
Reviews.Author: trippy82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The first morning we woke with bites, without knowing where they came from. Mosquitos? But the next night the same thing happened - we awoke at about 3am, turned on the light and there was a bug in the bed. I crushed it between two postcards, there was a lot of blood inside. We showed it to the manager, who gave us a discount and moved us to another (upgraded) room. However the next morning we woke up with more bites. Whether these were new or slow reactions from the previous room i don't know. I just got home and am washing all my clothes and luggage, so far I have found one bed bug which dropped out of my bag.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fashion Institute of Technology”
Reviews.Author: hamlet20
Reviews.Content: Short two blocks to FIT. CVS drug store around the corner. Antique shops. Close to 23rd subway & 28th subway stops. 23rd has cross town bus service to Chelsea Piers and to Chelsea Market. The market closes at 8pm but there is abundant nightlife around Chelsea. I favor this area over TIme Square. The hotel is older and not fancy but a good deal for New York. On a quiet street. Free internet, breakfast & minifridge :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: arthures
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn after reading past reviews. We were thrilled with the hotel. We stayed there for 5 days before heading off on a bus tour and re booked for a further 5 days at the end of the bus tour. The hotel is so central being an easy stroll to times square and all major tourist attractions. At the end of a busy day of sightseeing it is so relaxing to go over the road to Madison Gardens and take in the atmosphere of New York at its best. If we are ever fortunate enough to visit New York again we would certainly stay at the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Okay in a pinch, but would not recommend because of cleanliness issues.”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume89
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fine and I guess the rates are good (for New York City), and although the actual room was clean enough, the windows were filthy and very depressing. The window air conditioner was very loud. I walked around the neighborhood the next morning and found the Radisson Martinique--more expensive, but a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: newenglander60
Reviews.Content: While it doesn't look like much from the exterior, the Comfort Inn Chelsea is a small, cozy and clean place to stay in a great area of New York City. I stayed on the top floor of the hotel, in a tiny room with a king-size bed and an amazing view of the Empire State Building. While the room was very small, it didn't feel cramped. The bed was very comfortable, and the bedclothes were just right. The bathroom was also tiny, but immaculate, and had the expected amenities -- shampoo, conditioner, little soaps, etc. The room also had a small fridge. The public spaces -- hallways, elevators, lobby -- were small and felt a bit outdated, but again, everything was clean. The room rate included a continental breakfast, which is served in a lounge-type room off the lobby. Breakfast offerings were the usual fare at such places: hardboiled eggs, bagels, waffles, cold cereals, coffee and tea, etc. The coffee was actually pretty good. Staff were friendly and responsive. When I reported that a smoke detector was beeping in the hallway outside my room, the staff changed the battery right away. The Comfort Inn Chelsea is a few blocks away from Fashion Ave., Union Square, Gramercy Park, and the Flatiron Building, and just off Madison Square Park. From this central location, you can walk to many of New York's most popular attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great service, good location, amazing price. SOLID place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jthamkul
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better place to stay on our weekend trip to NYC. I tend to scour the internet for the best room for the best price when making vacation plans. Almost every hotel in Manhattan charged over $200 (closer to $300-900) per night, and the ones that did not were either in questionable/inconvenient locations or involved shared bathrooms/accommodations. What's more, when I cross-referenced available hotels with reviews on various sites, the $300+/night hotels received complaints about bed bugs and dirtiness. (And I am not going to pay $300+ for bed bugs!) When I found the Comfort Inn Chelsea, I was sold--rooms for way under $200/night in a great location and CLEAN. (Note: if you're looking for a place with a spa, incense, fireplaces or floral arrangements in the rooms, this is not the place for you.) The rooms are standard, cozy (read: small by non-NY standards) but perfect if you just want a safe, comfortable home base while exploring the city. The bed was incredibly comfy (even comfier that those at a certain 4-star hotel in LA where you can buy their "signature" bed). The basic complimentary breakfast is just icing on the cake. The service at the front desk is attentive, friendly, and helpful. They even helped me with a random request to use their shredder (work-related). As for location, this hotel is in the Flatiron District (a few blocks from the Flatiron Building). Jay Z's 40-40 club is down the block and there is a beautiful church across the street. There was a weekend market in the church parking lot with antiques and vintage items to peruse through and a 24-hour CVS right down the block. You can walk or catch a quick cab ride to the Village, Soho, Midtown, Grand Central Station and/or Times Square. All in all a SOLID place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access location at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a small triple room which was perfect from my extended family of 6. We had a 2 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a king and 2 bathrooms. The elevator was very slow and tiny! The price was unbelievable for the number of beds in our suite and the location. This hotel down a quiet street that seems a bit scary at night be we didn't have any problems. It is close to a couple subway stations which can take you anywhere in the city you want. If you do the "hop on hop off NY tours", there is a stop a half block away.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced NYC hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lynnja
Reviews.Content: So for starters, if you're looking to stay on the island of Manhattan, there has to be a base understanding that real estate is at a premium here - whether it is with apartments, condos or hotel rooms. So to expect an extravagantly sized hotel room in Manhattan - especially at an affordable price - is an extremely tall and rather unrealistic order. That being said, I stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea recently with a friend. This hotel has a great location - right in the heart of Chelsea. Very walkable to many points of interest. It was an unexpected treat that there were several regular weekend flea markets that are held within walking distance of the hotel. I found it a plus that the hotel was located on a block of 25th St. that was not too noisy. Despite that, I felt safe walking around the hotel in the wee hours of the night / morning. Anyway, the building is old, strikes me as pre-war era but appears to be decently maintained. The lobby is rather small but the hotel makes up for that with their friendly staff. They have a business center on the 1st floor as well which offer internet access. Admittedly, the hotel rooms are on the smaller side. However, they were clean and well maintained. We were able to find a room with 2 beds for approximately $160 for a Saturday evening in NYC - a deal which is simply hard to beat in midtown Manhattan. The bathroom was pretty modern though the bedroom decor seemed to be a bit dated. They did not have a flat screen in the room, rather an older television set with cable. I do have to reiterate that these are all minor details compared to the fact that the room was CLEAN. Especially in a place like NYC where there is so much to see and so much to do, you'll likely just need a place where you can lay your head down at night. I would recommend this hotel to friends any day. I would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here several times, nice hotel and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: TxLonestar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions over the last year. In my case, I was doing business nearby and it was very convenient. The rooms are small but I have stayed in some other NYC rooms that were even smaller. They have all of the basics, TV, wireless (and wired) internet, comfortable beds, etc. It is a short walk to several subway stations that can get you anywhere in NYC. For those that like to walk, its not far to several attactions, but far enough that if you don't like to walk, you will need to learn the subway/bus routes. There is a good chinese restaurant that is adjacent and a number of other good restaurants within a few blocks, but I typically find myself several blocks away for dinner. For breakfast, they offer a typical continental breakfast with cereal, fruit, breads, juices, etc. There is only 1 ice machine and it is in the lobby. If you buy drinks and want ice to go with them, just ask the lobby staff for a bag on your way back to your room and they will give you one for your ice (so you don't need to go up to your room to get it). The hotel has 2 elevators, one of which is small, and can be busy in the morning, I have used the stairs but these are narrow and windy so best to plan extra time. The hotel is popular with international tourists in the Spring/Summer and can get quite busy. A few of the rooms offer a view of the Empire state room but most do not offer any view other than a fire escape and other buildings and a few face an internal courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for New York City”
Reviews.Author: Virginiastamp
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for a hotel-based getway, but we loved it to see New York City. We got a room with a King and ended up with a reasonable sized room for a great price. The room was clean, and with the exception of Saturday night it was quiet. The hallways were narrow, but not at all unexpected. We ended up with a great view from the front of the hotel with a view of the Empire State building. In addition it had a free wireless which was perfect for us. The location was nice, we were two blocks from W line, two blocks from the Sex Museum, and right near the Flatiron building. I would definetely recommend this hotel over a hotel near Times Square or other touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great value.”
Reviews.Author: ccpr20
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times for business and one time for pleasure. The rooms are small (but that's NYC), but comfortable and clean. This has been consistent with each trip. They offer free continental breakfast. It's a great location - walk to restaurants, bars, etc. in Chelsea and beyond. We ate at Mesa Grill one night which is an easy walk of about 10 minutes. On the first day we walked up to Central Park - for a frame of reference. A bit of hike but walkable if you don't mind walking and checking out the neighborhoods. A subway stop is only a couple blocks away. Overall, this is a great value. If this is your rookie trip to NYC, I suggest staying here for the value until you can get your bearings. But if you're not going to spend much time in your hotel, you'll probably end up booking here again like we did.

Reviews.Title: “we recommend it to you all- a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lili052
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the comfort inn for these last 11 days. We chose it because we read good reviews about it here. The reviews were right on- this hotel is a great value for money. The room was big enough and clean, the breakfast was sufficient ( doughnuts, bagels, cheese ....) the staff was pleasant and helpful and the location was great. A walking distance from the main sites in NY. We had a great time and we can't wait to go back to NY and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel service I've had in a while”
Reviews.Author: ljm_8
Reviews.Content: I visited New York with my sister and booked at this hotel because of its price and location. The really great surprise was its staff and service. My sister is disabled and so we needed a hotel that had a ramp for the hotel entrance. But prior to the trip she had taken a downturn so she also needed to be able to use a scooter in the room itself. We live in different cities so I didn't even realize until we arrived together at the hotel what a problem that was going to be. The rooms at the Comfort Inn are average for New York, which means they are perfectly fine for one or two people, but not for maneuvering around in a scooter. When I realized the room I had booked wouldn't work I just kind of fell apart, I assumed the whole trip was going to be a disaster. But the Comfort Inn staff turned that all arround. They managed to upgrade us into a suite and, while that itself was a complete shock, what was even more amazing is that they made the change and moved our luggage, and put up with all our trouble, with incredible cheerfullness and good humor which continued, unabated, through the entire four nights of our stay. They always had time to give us directions and information and help in or out of the hotel. It was like staying with family. I should point out that the hotel does NOT advertise itself as accessible, it was my mistake to assume that my sister would only require a ramp (when she really required an accessible room as well). But Comfort Inn managed to make everything right. I can't tell you how grateful I was, and what a difference it made to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kitikata
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of it all in the Chelsea, Flatiron area of NYC, but it is on a quiet side street, so you can get away from it all. My relatives stopped by before we went out, and they live on a noisy NYC street. They made the claim that they couldn't sleep in our room because it was too quiet! I used frequent stay points for 3 nights for Halloween and the NYC Marathon, and I was given the top floor (11th floor) in the back (quieter than street noise). The room is bigger than any other NYC room I have ever had, and there was plenty of room for both of us to walk around and live comfortably for the 4 days, 3 nights. The room I got has a seating area with a full-sized pullout couch, a small closet, refrigerator, coffee maker, safe, desk, ironing board and iron. In the sleeping portion had 2 double beds, a night stand and cable TV. The beds had good sheets and were comfortable for me. The bathroom is small, but it has a full sized tub and shower. There was plenty of soap, shampoo, conditioner, and moisturizer for us, and 4 sets of towels. The windows open in the bathroom and bedroom in this hotel, so it was nice to get air in the room, and air out the bathroom after a shower. There is free wifi in the room, and there is an hardwire internet cord if you don't have wifi on your computer. There is a business center on the 1st floor, and there is a minimum $3 charge to use the computer and printer (we printed out tickets to the Empire State Bld). There is only one ice vending machine on the 1st floor. There are 2 well maintained elevators in the building, but they are slow, so going and getting ice from the 11th floor took a while. So, as we were going out for the evening, I took the ice bucket plastic bag in my purse. When we got back for the evening, I got ice from the ice machine on the 1st floor in the plastic bag to save me a trip back and forth on the slow elevators. There is vending on the 1st floor for soft drinks and snacks. Conveniently, there is a CVS at the end of the street if you need anything CVS carries. There is also a "Greek Deli" convenience market almost across the street from the CVS, so if you want any type of snack, soft drink, fruit, prepared "Greek Deli" foods 24 hrs/day, there you go. There is also a Chinese takeout place next to the lobby of the Comfort Inn. I don't know if it is good or not, but it is convenient. There is free breakfast at this hotel which includes breads, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice, milk and donuts. The breakfast room looks like it used to be a bar before the building became a Comfort Inn. There is also a small but efficient and free workout room with a treadmill and 2 other cardio machines, and a bottled water. The street this hotel is on is quiet, and not a main road where taxis drive, and our stay was very quiet! Along the street are some well established antique stores. On weekends, across the street in a parking lot, is NYC style flea market that has been there since the 1980s (or as long as we have known about it), and the trinkets, gifts, antiques, carvings, art, jewelry, jade, records, etc are well worth taking a look at on your way in and out of the hotel on Saturday or Sunday afternoons. Down at opposite end of the street from the CVS is Madison Square Park (where the original Madison Square Arena used to be). It appears for the month of October is a street fair with food vendors, and artisan shop vendors. There were crepes, beer, wine, frites, bbq, apple dumplings, Belgian waffles, and other tasty treats that were so good! The shop vendors had hand and artisan made jewelry, craft toys, hand bags, dolls, clothing, home decor and a lot of other craft goods. After Nov 1st they all were moving to Union Square for the holiday shopping time. Because we were there on Halloween, the Halloween Parade came down 6th Ave and ended about 2 blocks away from the hotel. Surprisingly, we heard no noise from the parade at all, inside the hotel! It was fun to people watch along the parade route, and it was almost better than N.O. during Mardi Gras. We were also there on Nov 1st, All Saints Day, and down 6th Ave again was this long street fair with fair food vendors and lots of trinket booths for as far as we could see! It was great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small, but quiet room”
Reviews.Author: AnnDelaware
Reviews.Content: One mistake I found from previous reviews - this hotel is not across from Chelsea Market. It is 1/2 block from Madison Square Park, with its temporary market and great Shake Shack. We were on the 4th floor, no view and very small but well appointed room. Very clean and updated bathroom. Could hear no outside or hall noise. The complimentary breakfast was typical Comfort Inn fare, but there was fresh fruit. Seemed like there were many European visitors. We left our bags there before and after checkout with no problem, The subway was around the corner, so we were close to all attractions. We saw West Side Storey - great show. Our trip to the Lower East Side Tenement Museum was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star, But Everything We Needed.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Luv
Reviews.Content: When you book, remember this is not a lavish property. We were out from 6am until at least 10pm every day, we always had hot water, clean towels (and plenty of them), the beds were extremely comfortable, and there was no noise at all (I usually stay in midtown, and have never had a quiet room). The hotel was booked solid, but we only saw one other person one time. The front desk staff was courteous. We were able to leave our luggage early on the day we checked in and late on the day we left. They didn't charge for it, we tipped the maintenance guy who took/brought our bags. The rooms are much smaller than the pictures on their website, but we didn't care. The fridge worked great (very unusual to even have a fridge in NYC) for us, as we always bring food from wherever. For you 'hanger counters' there were 8 wooden with the attached hooks, 4 had clips for pants or skirts. The Comfort Inn shampoo and soaps are standard, and I have very sensitive skin, but used them with no issues. You know what you are going to get. The free breakfast is continental, but we never had it as we were out exploring the city. There is a chinese restaurant directly next door, but we had such a long list of places to go, we never went there either. There were a few issues when we arrived, but they took care of them, including bringing us extra towels, even though I offered to bring them up myself, and from that time on, housekeeping left us the same number. The F Subway is round the corner, and a few blocks more to the 1, C, E. The Flatiron building is the other way (2 blocks) and the Chelsea Market is across the street. On Sunday it was fun to go into all the "garage sales" and flea markets on 25th street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinBrianDublin
Reviews.Content: Located just south of Midtown this is ideally placed to visit the shopping and attractions of uptown or the nightlife of downtown. Room was very small but the bed was massive so thats all that really mattered. The lift was incredibly slow and there was a musty smell in most corridors but I wouldn't let that put me off what was a good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for New York City”
Reviews.Author: agent1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and it was very clean, updated, and comfortable. We got a room on the 4th floor, and it was completely quiet---hard to believe we were in NYC. The room was small, but hey, it's New York. The small safe allowed us to set our own code, a nice feature. There was also a small fridge. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: MrMente
Reviews.Content: Our teens were first-timers in NYC and this hotel was pretty central to things we wanted to do. Rooms and bathrooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was OK. Staff was helpful if a bit indifferent. We had two rooms on 3rd and 4th floor, both with double double and pull-out sofa. If you wanted to squish in, you could get 5 people in one room. Paid about $220/room/night.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to buses and subway,helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: broadwaybabes
Reviews.Content: Good sized room for NYC-beautiful view of the Empire State Building from room 604. It was very nice to have a fridge and coffee maker in our room-breakfast gave a good start to the day and served until 10:00am if you needed to sleep in. Bus to uptown Manhattan a block away and subway station around the corner near Madison Square Park and Flatiron Building. Safe neighbourhood for walking and great food at Cafe 28!!! (3 blocks away)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a family room”
Reviews.Author: Philly2Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed one weekend at the Comfort Inn Chelsea with three adults andtwo children in thier Family Suite. It was two connected rooms. One room was two double beds, closet bureau and TV. The other had one double bed, the shared bathroom and bed furniture. For the price (online AAA rate of 333 inclusive of all charges) it was great. Quick and easy continental breakfast on the way out the door in the morning. short walk to a well connected subway station. We walked with our luggage to and from Penn Station in about 15-20 minutes. There are restuarants of all types nearby, good italian place for dinner that accepted kids on 21st, mexican, deli, subway, barbque joint on next block etc. Near a park to get some fresh air in the morning. Room was clean, staff was friendly and we were happy. We didn't expect luxury and it was not needed with trying to get the family a quick weekend away but it was just what we needed. And if you are into such things, Jay-Z's 40/40 club is on the same block. Free internet as well

Reviews.Title: “Hotel only ok, Staff not ok!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_in_20s
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotels location wasn't terrible but if you want to be up near Times Square, this is not the location for you. It's within walking distance to the Empire State building, Madison Square Gardens and Manhattan Mall. It is right beside the Flatiron Building. You can walk to Times Square but it's not very close. We chose it as it seemed to be fairly central to everything. The hotel is quite small in size. Our room was fine but tiny. We were given a room with a king size bed, which was nice. It was clean and comfortable, which was what we aimed for. It had a nice en-suite but the bed seemed to take up the whole room, we had little room left to put our bags. The breakfast wasn't great at all. Very little variety and the room again was small, so if there was a lot of guests down for breakfast, you had no where to sit. My biggest problem was the staff. I found the majority of staff to be very rude. For our entire stay, the majority of staff completely ignored me and only spoke to my boyfriend, beginning at checking in, where the booking was in my name, not my boyfriends, so I was the one they were dealing with, all during our stay, so for example if we walked in I would say 'Hello' or 'Good Moring' etc., they completely ignored me and only ever spoke to my boyfriend who hadn't even spoken to them, saying 'Good Morning Sir', right until the end, which again was me checking out! This might sound petty but it annoyed me enough to ruin our whole stay. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, for the price you could most likely get a nicer hotel nearer the action. It costs nothing to be polite, especially if you choose to be in the hospitality industry!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to much of the city”
Reviews.Author: Can2000
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit - centrally located, subway around the corner. Breakfast and coffee included in cost. Very reasonably priced. Room was comfortable and very clean. We would stay here again. Our kids rented bikes at a nearby bike shop (yes in February we were lucky to be there on a warm weekend) and rode to Central Park and back. The older folks took the subway. Whole Foods was a few blocks away. Staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My 40th Bday in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: ashmama
Reviews.Content: We chose Comfort Inn Chelsea, based on location mainly as the rate seems to be an average rate but here you get free wifi and breakfast in the price. We were on the 4th floor and were lucky to get a front facing room which had a fabulous view of the Empire State. Clean room with a king size bed, fresh towels and beds made every day. The self service breakfast is a disappoinment but sufficient to get you on your way till you find something outside. Ask for a list of directions from the reception- top 10 places to see, with easy tube or walking directions! Turn right out of the main door, walk to the end of the street and and you are onto Broadway, turn right again and two blocks down and you will see the 23rd street tube station. if you turn left at Broadway and a good 10 minute walk gets you to Times square. Turn left at the Hotel door and you walk onto 6th Avenue. There is Pennys, Cinema, Domino Pizza all within 5 mins walking of the Hotel, get directiosn from reception. We had a fab time, Manhatten lived upto my expectations...we did a helicopter trip and Horse carriage ride round Central park on my Bday...get an Explorer pass for 3,5 or 7 excursions you will save at least 2/3rds on the cost if bought seperately.... Century 21 (near Ground Zero, similar to TKmaxx but with bigger brand names) or a day trip to an Outlet is where you will get the bargains.Reduced Theatre tickets for the same day at Times Square, Views on top of the Rockerfellor Plaza and Empire State a must...have a fab time...wish I was going again....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: tagreen
Reviews.Content: I had a quick in-and-out into New York for a conference this December. I needed an economical place to stay and came across this place online. For $169 a night, it was a decent place to stay. The rooms are small and the building is old - thus, the heating and bathrooms were an issue. I got into my room and the temperature in the room was just slightly above the cold temperatures outside. I had to keep the window heater on high all night. The bathroom never did warm up - but as mentioned above - if your looking for a cheap, clean room in a good location - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Manhattan hotels over the past year. The Comfort Inn in Chelsea was very nice, especially for its price range, and goes on the list of places I'd be happy to return to if my favorites are not available for a reasonable price. Pleasant, efficient staff; not over-the-top, but the hotel posts its "Satisfaction Guarantee" at the front desk and the staff seems to be well-oriented in customer service. Good-sized room. I should mention that, while I was in NYC, the UN General Assembly was meeting, as were two other huge conferences, attracting heads of state from around the world to the miserably-gridlocked city and, other than the room I got (and it was the last room available at this hotel) there were virtually no other hotel rooms to be found in Manhattan for under $400, starting about three weeks before I arrived. The only room I could get here was an oddly-proportioned one with three twin beds. It was an unusual arrangement, especially for one person, but the beds were reasonably comfortable, pillows were OK, the room was very clean (even under the beds), there was free (albeit slow) wireless internet in the room, a free continental breakfast buffet in a room off the lobby (standard Comfort Inn breakfast -- waffle maker, whole fruit, hard-boiled egg, cold cereal, instant Quaker oatmeal, toast, juice, etc.), and a refrigerator in the room (I always prefer a refrigerator to an over-priced mini-bar). The bathroom was tiny, but had a toilet, sink, and shower stall, and standard Comfort Inn toiletries. The hotel is about 10 blocks south and two blocks east of Penn Station (easy walk) and two blocks east of a Whole Foods supermarket (from which to stock the refrigerator in the room). The nearest subway stop is two blocks south of the hotel. Plenty of restaurants all around. There was some street noise at night, but it is NYC. All in all, I found it to be a good hotel to know about.

Reviews.Title: “Decent NYC room at a good price”
Reviews.Author: jddphd
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Chelsea is one of the handful of hotels in NYC where you can get a nice, clean, centrally-located room with a decent bed and not spend a giant wad of money. I stayed there in August 2008 during the height of the tourist season for $225 + tax and I've regularly booked sub $200 rooms on off-peak nights. It's walking distance to Penn Station to good restaurants and bars. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMD
Reviews.Content: My mam and dad booked our family (5 total) into the Comfort Inn Chelsea, Manhattan last October as they were celebrating their 25th Anniversary. Every one of us agreed that the Comfort Inn is exactly what you need in New York. It is close to the Subway, walking distance to Times Square, near good restaurants and stores. YET.....it is on a quiet street so you are not assaulted with the noise of the hussle and bustle of New York. Perfect. The Breakfast served was less then impressive but I am sure it is the standard of other hotels. Our toilet did overflow once but it was soon corrected by a maintenance guy who came up very fast. Our room was a family room with Two Double Beds in one room and it was connected to a room with a Double bed and the toilet...It was clean and functional. Overall for anyone going to New York, Comfort Inn Chelsea is the place to stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: anyajimt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a trip with family. My parents had been to this hotel once and liked it enough to return. It beat everything around it cost-wise by far. It was conveniently located for us in the middle of Chelsea where we were attending an art exhibit opening. We were easlily able to walk to subway entrances to get to places outside Chelsea. Not being from New York City, but rather the more spacious southen half of the US., I was not used to such a tiny- and I do mean tiny room. But, I understand this is the ropes in NYC. Anything larger would have cost much more. The room was clean and four adults managed in the space. We had to laugh as we stratigically placed luggage and announced to each other to clear a pathbefore trying to walk around the room. The bathroom was nicely tiled and clean. The lobby was very nice- again, small, but nice- and the staff friendly. The breakfast was your usual fair, set up in a decent dining area/bar off the lobby. We chose to eat out a great Greek cafe around the corner the second day- liked it so much we ate dinner there too. There were several bars/restaurants nearby to choose from for a drink at night also and it felt safe walking around the area at night. If you are on a budget and want cleanliness and convienience in the heart of Chelsea- this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Carol119
Reviews.Content: You know how people say a hotel in NYC - 'It's just a place to sleep'? That's what this is. But you can get a surprisingly good sleep here. The beds are comfortable and the pillows amazing. I was tempted to try to put one in my suitcase (But of course I didn't). The room was tiny: if you left shoes out you were likely to trip over them; but it was clean and - as mentioned - the bed and pillows were great. Family in a two bed room had the same experience. Also, the bathroom, again, while small, seemed to have been recently remodeled. If only the towels were as sensational as the pillows. We had a king room on the second floor and while it was a nonsmoking room & hotel, there were ashtrays in the room and one night the smell of cigarettes was kind of intense. Our room had a window on an air shaft with an ac in the window so it could not be opened. The breakfast was fine and served in the ironically named (windowless) 'sunshine room'. We couldn't get onto the wifi, but there was a plug in for the computer that worked fine. The location near the flatiron bldg was central and near a decent shopping area. It was by JayZee's 40/40 club (per my teenage nephew) so we could admire the Escalades parked there. Some staff seemed indifferent but Michael at the desk and the gentleman who stored our bags after check out - a great and free feature - were most gracious and helpful. The small lobby was surprisingly comfortable. We booked late so paid way too much, but if you can get a reasonable price, it is an ok place to stay - because you really only need a place to sleep. And did I mention the pillows?

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Surprise”
Reviews.Author: bigdog6668
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Comfort Inn Chelsea was a huge surprise. I arrived early on the day on my check-in (12 PM) and asked if a room was available. They placed me in room 303 which actually turned out to be a two room suite. It was the largest hotel room I have ever had in NYC. I opened up my curtains and had a great view of the Empire State Building. My room was clean, spacious, and quiet and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The elevator wasn't great but most of the time I walked the three floors to my room. The conference I was attending was at 36th and Broadway, an easy 11 block walk. I was initially concerned about making the walk during the evenings but that was no problem even at 10 PM as many people were walking the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC Choice”
Reviews.Author: garyLS
Reviews.Content: By New York standards, this hotel is a great deal. The location is very good, especially for someone who wants to be near the Village, Union Square or, as the name implies, Chelsea. It's even convenient to other parts of town as subways are right nearby. The hotel is clean and modern. The staff are relatively courteous and efficient. Yes, the rooms are small but in NY, so are most hotel rooms that go for less than $400 a night. The free wireless internet worked well and the free breakfast won't win any culinary awards, but it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: FerryBoy
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, the exasperated staff gave us a very shabby and cramped room that reeked of cigarettes, with a step-up bathroom and a window looking out onto a garbage-strewn and barbed wire-filled lot. Granted, it was only $200 a night in Manhattan, but still. So we asked for another room, and despite the staff's protests, they gave us a rather nice room, up a few stories, bright, clean and not stinky. This room was definitely worth the money, and we enjoyed our stay quite a bit. The breakfast was non-descript, but the location is very good. Just a couple blocks from the Flatiron Building and the subway entrance, and a nice stroll into Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping In A Shoe Box”
Reviews.Author: pittston
Reviews.Content: Truly the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The bathroom is smaller than those found in travel trailers and requires a dangerous step up on a narrow tread. The advertised refrigerator is actually a cooler that will not keep milk cold. Even the toilet is a small round type barely large enough to perform its function with a slow refill rate. The window looks out onto a brick wall. The rugs were last replaced in 1985. The hall corridors are not wide enough for two children to pass each other side by side. The bed was comfortable and the in-room internet connection does work as does the television in every other room that you can hear through the walls. I thought I found a downtown bargain at $159 but I will gladly stay somewhere else for more money my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomMidwest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea three times in the last few months. One thing to remember is that hotel prices in Manhattan are always high relative to comparable properties most anywhere else in the US and also vary drastically on a seasonal basis. For instance, I just checked prices for a trip in January, and the rate here - and elsewhere - is at least $100 less per night than it was in October. This hotel is generally a very good option at the lower end of a price range that will still provide for lodging that is safe, clean and conveniently located in the city. Beyond price, I've found the desk staff to be accomodating, and the housekeeping and maintenance staff to be very pleasant and efficient. My rooms have varied in size from very small to comparable to an average hotel room elsewhere. All the rooms have been clean and well equipped, and I have always felt safe. Free wired and wireless internet is a plus, as is the free breakfast. There is a lovely park just about a block away, and many restaurants and shops of all types and all prices within the surrounding neighborhood. The subway is very close, too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay -- if the price was in line w/ amenities/rooms, it'd be great.”
Reviews.Author: tralala4
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in room 702 at the Chelsea Comfort Inn in November. I have to admit, this hotel was not my first choice, but the NYC Marathon was taking place the same weekend I needed to be in the city for business, so I had to take what I could get. After reading mixed reviews on this site, I was hoping for the best but expecting the worst. The hotel is a bit shabby around the edges – the common areas and rooms themselves could do with small maintenance upgrades that would improve the aesthetics all around. Some fresh paint on luggage-scuffed molding and cleaned-up sticky tables in the bar/breakfast/coffee area would make a rough-around-the edges hotel much more welcoming. Having said that, my room was comfortable and clean. Since the only room left in all of NYC for marathon weekend was #702, with three single beds for one person, it was sort of comical that I had my choice of three beds! However, the room was adequately sized, and probably for two people would also be comfortable. I think that three people sharing this room might crowd each other a bit. For three people, the narrow wardrobe and three full-sized drawers (plus nightstands) could be inadequate – for me, it was fine. There is also a full length mirror in addition to a large mirror behind the desk. There was a utilitarian bathroom, which was clean and stocked with hotel brand shampoo, conditioner, etc. Hot water took some time to kick in, but was adequate once it got going. I am a harsh judge of hot water supplies, since I have long, thick hair that is time-consuming to shampoo – finishing a rinse in icy water is not fun. Happily, this was not the case here. I did have trouble figuring out the idiosyncrasies of the hotel hair dryer, but Maintenance showed up in my room within minutes of my requesting help and showed me the right combination of buttons to push to get it started. Since it required some non-intuitive steps, I suggest updating the dryers or at least placing a short, well-written set of instructions next to the dryers. The fall temperature fluctuated between chilly and just-right, and the combination heating/cooling system in the room was fine and kept me comfortable. To my relief, there was a small desk in the room so I could easily set up my laptop properly. I was glad I’d brought along my own Ethernet cable since the one the hotel provided wasn’t working. The hotel room fridge had some unappetizing stains in it, but was obviously scrubbed and I felt fine putting take-out food in it. On a side note, the fridge was also properly cool. My boyfriend has diabetes and needs to store insulin when we do travel together, so I have become somewhat of an expert on hotel room refrigerator temperatures. I’m happy to say, this would have been fine for his needs, too. However, I have no idea why the room’s carpeting left black marks on my new white socks! The carpet appeared clean, but the sooty stains on my socks were definitely suspect. Linens were clean and the mattresses and pillows were comfortable. I should note that the hotel lobby and also my room’s bathroom had a strong smell of the type of odor-neutralizing spray they use to mask cigarette odors. Although my room was nonsmoking, underneath the smell of the disinfectant I could tell someone had smoked something in my bathroom in the not-too-distant past. However, this is not the hotel’s fault, and the spray’s odor was obnoxious but not unbearable. The hotel breakfast is a nice touch (cereals, muffins, etc), but nothing extraordinary. I certainly have had worse “free” hotel continental breakfasts, and “bland” is the keyword here, but not unappetizing. The coffee doesn’t have much kick, but since it is free and to-go cups are available, it is a good boost until you can find better coffee in the neighborhood. It was easy to hail a cab – they’re plentiful outside. Seems there is also a little flea market across the street on the weekends, and every kind of store you could want in the neighborhood. The walls are thin – at one point my neighbors voices sounded as if they were in my room! But, that lasted about five minutes, which made me wonder if perhaps they were in the lobby after all. At about 2am, there was a commotion down the street – a celebration or street party or some sort of Saturday night revelry. I turned on the room’s air system and the white noise drowned the street noise. The evening front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The daytime desk staff were also helpful, but “friendly” is not a word I’d use to describe them. There is a difference between a NYC non-nonsense attitude and the day staff’s downright brusque attitude – they might want to try a smile or two or consider eye contact when speaking to guests. All in all, I would stay here again with a caveat about price. My real sticking point is that there are “nicer” boutique hotels in Murray Hill for the same price as the Chelsea Comfort Inn, but with some luxury amenities and arguably better location. If the Chelsea would lower the room price, I’d stay here again. However, if my next visit is not during a peak time –like the Marathon – I would go to a boutique hotel for the same price, first.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: goeast140
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the beds comfy & lots of pillows, always had hot water, maid always had the room done, even had an okay breakfast. We had a 2 room suite (with fridge) on the 9th floor overlooking the ESB...awesome veiw! We booked a year in advance through Choice Hotels and payed $170 a night without tax...watch out, the tax IS a shocker! Great rate for 5 ppl. The location was very centralized. Most of all, the hotel staff were all super friendly and helpful...we must have asked directions 100 times and never did they seem annoyed. They went beyond the call of duty! WAY TO GO GUYS! My sister liked the 24 hour coffee, my husband liked the on site bar. The Chinese take out was connected to the hotel, easy access with good food. There is a CVS drugstore 5 minutes away, stayed open late. McDonald's close by. Laundermat a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “12 days of adventure for a family from Alaska-”
Reviews.Author: Wharton6
Reviews.Content: I searched all the travel helps sites I could to find the best hotel to meet our needs. I have four children 17, 15, 15, and 11. We are too big a family to fit in any regular hotel room. The Comfort Inn offered "family rooms" to accomodate all six of us. I booked the rooms six months in advance to get the rate of $279/night for two rooms- one king bed and two queen! That is great for New York rates. The rooms were small but we were site seeing most of the time. The beds were comforable which was really important since we were probably on our feet 8-12 hours a day and needed good rest. The maid service was great. I had read poor reviews of the hotel even just one month before we traveled to New York so we were afraid... don't be afraid! We stayed on the sixth floor in a room that looked out to a beautiful old church. We could see the top of the Empire State Building from our room also. Madison Square Garden and the Empire State Building are only about few blocks from the hotel. We never ran out of hot water, the elevators are slow but the hotel had two of them. The continental breakfast was nice with fresh fruit, juice, bagels, hard boiled eggs, cereal, toast, and milk. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. It costs to use the hotel computer and there was no free internet hookup if you bring your own computer. The hotel is in the most perfect location because you can catch the subway only about 2 blocks away to go any which way. If you want to go to Time Square it is only 2 subway stops away. We found that if each of us bought a week long subway pass that was the best deal for us. The kids were pro subway riders in no time. Only four people can ride a cab at a time so we would have had to take two to go places. We were able to walk and take the subway everywhere! We bought a site seeing package on the 2nd day so we could go by double decker bus to see Brooklyn and all of the major popular places in Manahtten. We were able to identify places that we would like to spend more time at this way. We also took a two hour boat ride around Manhattan Island and that was awesome. We spent a lot of time in Time Square but it was cheaper for food and souvenirs down towards Chelsea area or in China Town. There is a flea market and antique stores all along 25th where the hotel is located. There are many deli's, restaurants, and a pharmacy within 2 or 3 blocks. The chinese food restaurant outside the hotel lobby was a favorite with the kids. Our favorite tour was to see the Statute of Liberty, which is really inexpensive but the lines are really long... so be prepared to wait in line. Central Park was beautiful in March and we just happened to get a few days of warm weather and sunshine in March! Bring an umbrella though... it rained some of the time. We bought tickets on line to see the Knicks and we saw the Pirate Queen on Broadway. We bought reduced tickets down on Time Square. To get to and from the airport we scheduled with Super Shuttle and we were dropped off and picked up at the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaVincent
Reviews.Content: My usual Murray hill hotels were booked, so I took a shot with this, and loved it. The staff were courteous and very welcoming. The room was adequate in size, and the bathroom more than adequate, with hot water, good pressure and bright lighting. The room Air Conditioning was little rackety, and I had to hit it a few times. There was a nice market nearby that had good prepared meals. The lounge was sorta nice/nasty, very pleasant for a cool beverage. I didn't eat there, but in the morning folks liked breakfast, it seemed. Very quiet, no noisy euro-types! All in all, for under $175, I hit the jackpot. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TTT_NNN
Reviews.Content: great location, poor service, not clean, not enough hot water, not enough towels. in short - find another place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: BringHomeTroops
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. It is in a great location for me and the price was reasonable. My room was decent, it looked to be updated within the past year or so. It was much nicer than I was expecting. A little small but size was really OK for NY. However, I had a very difficult time getting hot water, thus the bad rating. I came to NY for a cooking class so when I got back to my room at 10:00 pm I was filthy and covered with grease. Definitely looking forward to a shower. I ran the shower for 20 minutes and got no hot water so I called the desk. An engineer was sent up to my room and confirmed no hot water. He did make a flippant comment though… “It’s the summer anyway, you don’t really need hot water, do you?” Uuhh, yes! I called down to the front desk again. This time I was told that nobody else had called and it must be just my floor. He didn’t offer me a room on another floor where I would supposedly find hot water. He said they would “re-set” the system and in 20 minutes I should have hot water. Well no hot water was available after 45 more minutes so I went to bed unhappy. I had a hard time sleeping. When I got up around 8:00am, there was hot water. When I came back at 11:00am there was none. When I checked out I complained…they do have a “guarantee”. The manager told me that yes, sometimes the boiler is turned off in the summer. But kept waffling about the details. Maybe it is “accidentally” turned off. I couldn’t quite get an answer with him going in circles trying hard not make good on their promise to not charge for an unpleasant stay. The impression I got was that hot water is available only during certain peak hours. So if you only want hot water during these hours then I could recommend the hotel. A hot shower available 24/7 is important to me especially during the summer when I am walking around in hot humid weather. So unfortunately I will not be returning. As a side, checking in and out took a while. Even though there appeared to be at times several folks available to help, only one person did the work, thus the wait. They did hold my luggage on check out day until late afternoon, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FernLaPlante
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a hotel in Manhattan that was clean and in a great location and that wasn't ridiculously expensive. I came across the Comfort Inn in Chelsea and got a great deal directly through their website. The hotel is clean and cozy. The rooms are typical for a NYC hotel (on the smallish side) but were kept VERY clean. The floors each have weird fire doors on each floor that make the overall layout of the floors small and oddly configured but it made no matter to us. The hotel really more on the FlatIron District but is within walking distance of Chelsea, Union Square, Times Square, Herald Square and Hell's Kitchen (if you walk a lot - we do.) It is convenient to the subway and lots of restaurants. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"More than a Fair Deal"”
Reviews.Author: Aymeric
Reviews.Content: Close to the real Chelsea scene, this Comfort Inn is steps away from all the major subway/bus you could want. OK - it's obviously not upscale, but basically fair and above just decent in all respects - AND for the well under -$200 special (senior) rate I got through the ChoiceHotels website, let's consider this absolutely unbeatable. Ongoing renovations seem under control. Single slowish elevator, as reviews say - so what's wrong with walking down the stairs occasionally? Friendly desk staff. Lots of young families as guests when I stayed in early April. Narrow halls. Room? Surprisingly spacious ((booked a single and got a king-size bed) , clean, with newly refurbished bath; a firmer mattress and better lighting would have been a plus (room must used sometimes to create a larger suite via the inside door; luckily, the next room neighbor was not noisy, though there is problem potential here ...) Unexciting "continental"-type breakfast on at rear on lobby floor (NB: for that occasional in-room meal, great takeout at WF on 24th/7th nearby). Nothing fancy, but excellent location - just off Madison Square Park - with very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaRH
Reviews.Content: I think I must have been lucky in comparison to other reviewers as the king room I had (804) not only had plenty of space but a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Yes, there was some traffic noise and much merriment coming from the 4040 Club on Saturday night/Sunday morning, but not enough to make having a room at the front of the hotel a problem. Everything worked as it should and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. Also, there was a good range of channels available on the TV which was great for that hour where you're collapsed in a heap before heading to bed. It was also nice to have the fridge to store drinks and small snacks. The location is also great - far enough away from the main tourist area to avoid the tackier side of NYC but with excellent access to everywhere you might want to go, either on foot or by public transport. On a slightly less positive note, while the decor and furnishings were fine the recent renovations seem to have been rushed, as it was obvious that a good few shortcuts had been taken. Also, the air conditioning/heating is very noisy, so could not have this on while trying to sleep. The desk staff were efficient if rather indifferent and the complimentary breakfast was okay if you just wanted to grab some cereal or a bagel - aside from that, it was quite dire. Weighing it all up though, I'd still return to this hotel quite happily. I booked reasonably far in advance so got my room for $107 a night plus taxes, a real bargain for the overall quality of the hotel and the area it's in. Also, as a lone female I never once felt threatened or unsafe while wandering around the area on my own. One final recommendation - on a warm evening its a real pleasure to pick up a coffee and enjoy it in lovely Madison Square Park, watching the madness of Fifth Avenue and appreciating the unique beauty of the Flatiron building.

Reviews.Title: “New Life in Old Hotel”
