Reviews.Author: kipukatrading
Reviews.Content: Seemingly, Choice Hotels has breathed back life into this former Chinese owned Hotel Arlington in Chelsea. The rooms are now clean, cheerier and the amenities like high speed internet are dependable. The staff is friendly and the location can't be beat! Walk to restaurants and attractions in this centrally located property. On weekends, there is an interesting swap meet across the street in a parking lot. No problems here. Definitely the best hotel value for under $200 per night in Manhattan. The downside is that the rooms are tiny and partying tourists can be an annoyance in the hallways and next door. The views are dark and dim and uninspiring, but , hey, you are only sleeping here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Comfort Inn Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: happyParent
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience. The room, although small with the two twin beds, was very clean and the service was great. The staff was very helpful and cordial. The property is conveniently located to Times Square and NYU. I would stay here again and recommend it to all my associates. Great job Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: PlanoGuys
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually very nice for the price. It is located on 25th in Chelsea (near 25th and Broadway). Our room was small like a cruise ship cabin. It was big enough for a king sized bed, small fridge, dresser, and desk. It also had a small closet for storing your suit cases and to hang your clothes. Everything seemed recently remodeled and new. This particular room had no view at all except for the backs of other buildings. The room also had a safe that was big enough for us to store our laptops, cameras, and portable dvd player. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone who needs a wheelchair ramp. When we were there it was a temporary ramp that went straight up from the sidewalk to the entrance (you can see the ramp in one the pictures posted by others). It is doable but you might need help. The hotel had a small bar and business center with a computer with internet access. We didn't use either of them but saw others using them. Overall, the hotel was very good for the price and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Broken Hotel and no sleep”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeGem
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an electrical problem on the day I was scheduled to be booked. They were unhelpful in telling me when the problem would be over and because their computers were down I couldn't even be checked in. I arrived, mind you, at 10:45pm on a Friday night to hopefully sleep. At midnight I finally decided to call the choice hotels number to potentially book me another room. They almost left me stranded or asked me to book a far more expensive hotel and that they couldn't cancel my reservation at this hotel because this hotel had to do it from their own computers... which were DOWN. Finally after much [--] I booked a hotel across town through choice hotels and had to [--] and scream to not be counted as a "no show" on the Friday I was booked for and could not check in. Avoid this trap of a hotel. I was never even offered any compensation, free ride, discount... NOTHING! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: abar85
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with a pretty good location. The subway is one block away, and you're just 2-3 stops away from Times Square. We were in NYC to spend New Year's Eve (if you have the chance don't miss it). We were six in a suite, and we did fit in there, but our suitcases didn't... LOL., but we gotta say the price was great, and what the hotel was offering was everything we needed. The staff was great, they were all very friendly... the only one who didn't help that much was the manager (Amit or something like that). In a few ocassions, he made us feel as if we didn't belong there, and as if we should be thankful, since he was "doing us the favor" to help us. Other than that... it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, Fab staff GREAT BAR!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: As previously stated on reviews not much to look at on the outside, but cant rate it highly enough inside. Rooms although small by UK standards were spotless clean and immaculate, everything you needed iin them, TV, Ironing board and iron, tea and coffee, fridge, safety box, hairdyer. Cleaned every day we were there 28th Nov - 3rd December. Location great walked just about everywhere, myself and friend had both our two young girls ( 9 and 10) and had a double double room, both girls slept on the sofa bed and altho made the room cramped we were only in it to sleep. Latest we left the hotel was 9 in the morning and earliest back 9pm!!! Reception staff - one of whom is a Brit were extremely helpfull when one of the suitcases was lost in transit eventually delivered 3 days later and the piece de resistance for 2 single parents - the bar!!! Owned by Nick and his partner along with Patricia and not actually by the hotel we spent 2 very long nights in bar whilst girls quite happily played on the internet adjoined. Breakfast altho simple, bagels, doughnuts, muffins and lashings of coffee, tea and orange juice and cereals was just right and very nice. Staff extremely helfull when we booked helicopter trip from 59th Street, and cheaper as well.. Tip - book any trips you intend to go on direct with the company in the US much cheaper especially due to exchange rate. Viacom.com for thetare tickets excellent seats for Les Miserable. Alreday booked for a girlie shopping trip in Decmber this year at hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A nightclub nearby”
Reviews.Author: Sujico
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a three single bed room and two twin bed rooms. The bathroom of our three bed room was so tiny, but beds were comfortable. The two single bed room which faces the street is bigger but noisier, because there is a nightclub nearby. I was very tired and slept well, but my friend couldn't sleep all night. The room which is on the other side of the street is smaller but quiet. All the rooms I stayed were clean, but some of our sheets were very crumpled and made me nervous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: Rachybabes999
Reviews.Content: Just a few lines to review this little gem of a hotel. Must admit that its not much to look at from the outside and the decor inside is not as flashy as previous 2 star hotels we have stayed at. However, the service was excellent, the room was average size and very clean. Huge king size bed, tv, spotless bathroom. One of the best things about this hotel is its location. Turn right as you leave the hotel and it puts you directly in front of the flatiron building, with Madison Square Park close by if you like feeding squirrels. Head uptown along broadway and you are a 10 minute walk from Macys and the Empire State Building and just a little further along to Times Square. Head uptown from Park Ave South and you are only 10 mins away from Grand Central and Bloomingdales. I never realised before just how close things are on foot and we didnt use a taxi once!!! Subway station is just in front of the Flatiron building. We will definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean basic 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark75248
Reviews.Content: This is a decent 2* NYC property. I stayed in November 2006, when all the 3* hotels around town where I usually stay were priced thru the roof. The hotel was fine. The room was small but clean. You can typically tell the difference between a 2* and a 3* hotel, and this was no exception: the mattress is thinner, the towels aren't as soft, the soaps are smaller. My view was an airshaft. The A/C (not needed this time of year) is a window unit. If you're looking for a decent, clean basic place to stay, and budget is a primary concern, then the Comfort Inn fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: miss_elle_woods
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September and it was definitely great value for money. The hotel is clean and although the rooms were small and the breakfast was questionable (we gave up after the first two days as the breakfast room was tiny and they stopped letting people serve themselves!!) everywhere was clean and tidy and the location was superb. The hotel is within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Macy's, the shops on 5th Avenue and Greenwich village, and there is great access to a number of subway lines nearby. It wasn't the Ritz but this wasn't what we were expecting for the price we paid. A nice comfortable hotel for those on a budget! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: 3pltdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to see the Macy's Thanksgiving parade. We booked the family suite which was two double beds in one room and a queen in a separate room with a bathroom. Both rooms had TVs. The master room had a refrigerator and coffee pot. Like most NYC hotel rooms, the space is tight, but the two room layout was nice to let the kids have their own area. Room and hotel was clean and service was pleasant. The bathtub/shower was good. Complimentary breakfast was very simple...donuts, bagels, toast, and muffins. Walked a few blocks to subway and 6th Ave to catch a taxi to go uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: treble99united
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Rooms are relatively small but have everything you need including en-suite, free internet access and tea/coffee making facilities. Room was very clean and was cleaned every day also. Great value for money and only a 10min walk from the Empire State. Most of the tourist spots were within walking distance although Central Park was about a 45min walk away. Only 1 block from Subway station. Staff were very polite and helpful. Breakfast was cheap and cheerful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2MNTravelers
Reviews.Content: Do not miss this hotel! No bad things to say! We stayed on the 4th floor, front and had a view of the Empire State Building! The room was clean, bed was comfortable, free wireless access, free continental breakfast had a good variety, and the staff was friendly and accomodating! We paid $219/night during the week and had no expectations but was pleasantly surprised upon checkin. Great location and near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Economical Stay, and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Indus5
Reviews.Content: 4 of my friends and I stayed at this Comfort Inn for Sep 8-10th 2006. The hotel itself has undergone a major cosmetic overhaul and is much nicer than when I stayed here 10 years ago. The rooms are well appointed, clean, nothing fancy. The rooms also have extra utilities like an iron, safe, wireless internet+wired internet etc. which was surprising. Our stay was comfortable, the staff were friendly. They let us check-in early, and even had a valet service for our bags when we checked out so we didn't have to lug them around for our last day in Manhattan. For the price ($215/night) it was a great find and was easy on the budget. The location can't be beat. A block from the Flatiron building, and in the midst of all the action. 25th Street is really in the heart of Manhattan so you're central to downtown, midtown, uptown, wherever. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sopink
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea with family for 4 days and the experience was great! The room that I stayed in was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but also clean. The hotel has a charming lobby. The free breakfast was wonderful! Hotel is close to subway and many attractions (Empire State Building, etc.). Would definitely stay here again!:)

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, not bad, just fine.”
Reviews.Author: threekiddos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Chelsea with our three children (ages 7,4,2) after finding that most hotels were unable to accomodate five due to fire code and the costs were getting exorbitant as I checked around. We had a suite - one king bed in one room and two double beds in the other, with one bathroom ($279.00 per night). Our expectations were low given prior reviews, but knowing we would be in the room very rarely and that Comfort Inn should have a decent standard, we booked the hotel. The staff was definitely above average - very courteous, helpful, professional and kind. The hotel is decent. The elevator and corridors could use a facelift. A permanent ramp should be installed outside. The breakfast was okay. The seating area was dark and a hodge podge - it was a previously bar and had a lot of stuff sitting on it. The rooms were typical New York small, but were comfortable, the bathroom was clean. The safe was broken, but another was brought in shortly. As I mentioned above, the staff was very helpful. The air conditioning units were noisy, one room had it partially duct-taped, but we still slept fine. The location was good, a fairly residential/business area - not far from the Yellow line on the subway (you have to transfer quite a bit to get to different locations in the city, but this wasn't bad - even with three young kids) - and it is across from Madison Square Park and the Flatiron building. There is also a nice view of the Empire State Building as you cross over at Madison Square Park. Parking was also a consideration for us. With a stamp from the hotel, we paid $18.00 a day to park our minivan one block from the hotel with 24-hour access to it. Some hotels I checked were as high as $45.00 a day. Check-out was at noon, which was nice, and the staff held our bags for us, so we could continue to enjoy the city the remainder of the day. My husband and I stayed at The Library Hotel in May. This was a lovely hotel in a great location, and the price reflected it ($375 per night for one queen bed, lovely but small room with nice breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon). As long as your expectations are realistic, I think Comfort Inn Chelsea is a fine place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An Impressive 'Facelift'”
Reviews.Author: quindad
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn`s renovation of what was formerly The Arlington Hotel is nearly completed. The elevators and breakfast room still need to be refurbished, but the guestrooms, themselves, are beautiful. The hotel is in a terrific location, adjacent to beautiful Madison Square Park and convenient to 3 different subway stops. The compact lobby is certainly pleasant enough and the smiling front desk staff is amiable and efficient. Our room was the biggest surprise. We had reserved a room with 2 double beds and sitting area with a sofa. It was spacious and everything is new and pristine here. All is tastefully decorated, wallpaper and carpeting are unblemished and the original crown molding is still intact and is a nice touch. The bathroom is all new and virtually sparkles. Comfort Inn`s standard amenities are included. We had free local phone calls, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, small refrigerator, free morning newspaper, and continental breakfast included. There is also a small exercise room and business center. Our new beds were firm and extremely comfortable and everything was very quiet, including the new air conditioner which was appreciated in the sultry July heat. For all this we paid $169, which is a great deal for New York. This is a winner and a great value. We`ll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arlington Hotel for 5 nights in May and was very satisfied with what I got for my money. Although the room was small – what you have to expect even at 4* hotels in NYC – and had no view I would come back definitely. The room and bathroom were recently renovated (a little smell of fresh paint was still in the air). Most important: Cleanliness was way above what I expected and I got fresh towels every day. OK, you don’t have any gimmicks at the hotel itself, but you’re located in the middle of everything (1min. to Flatiron Bldg., 10 min. to Union Squ. or Empire State Bldg.). Restaurants and shops are within walkable distance. There is also easy access to several subway lines (N;Q;R;W just around the corner) and others on Park Ave. South or 6th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Arlington Hotel for 3nights in early April with my college, and after where we had stayed on our previous trip to amsterdam i wasnt expecting much at all. When we first arrived i thought hmm looks abit shabby, (there was building work going on) and it was down a quiet street. when we got inside there was some improvement (nice ceiling lol) but a very small hallway/reception, from this still wasnt expecting much but when we got to our rooms i was amazed. it was a lovely room, like a 3/4* hotel room, lovely bathroom and a nice shower that gives u more than a trickle of water unlike alot of hotels, the room was very big split into 2 rooms as i was sharing with 3 friends. the rest of the hotel isnt very nice but the rooms are great and we then found out that although its down a quiet street just a 5minute walk down the road you are at madison sqaure and a 10/15 min walk you are at the fantastic times sqaure. theres a nice cafe called cafe broadway around the corner that we went to for pancakes every morning, definately recomend going there. it was a fantastic holiday although short, i will never forget it, and i would definately return to the Arlington hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: IM NOT EVEN GONNA BOTHER SAYING MUCH JUST TO SAY DONT GO THERE IF U WANT SOMEWHERE CLEAN TO STAY. not only is it dirty and smelly, the walls are peeling, the baths are black from staining and the lifts dont always get u where u wanna go!!!!!also the staff are rude and dont speak english!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing - perfect - was expecting to be disgusted !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Now i havnt got many hotels to compare this too, and i havnt stayed in any hotels in new york before so whatever ever you make of my review, i hope it is helpful. First of all there was a lovely smell of paint as i entered the dated the hallway, but it was all part of the fun - i stayed in room 403 on floor 4 and my view had a beautiful view of the empire state building. I now relise our group had one of the best views of all as some others had barbed wire as their view but for a group of 37 this hotel was perfect. The staff were happy to help me when i left a cd and theatre programme in a restaurant. And the bedroom (triple) was VERY spacious and clean perfect prices. It was also a 20 minute walk from times square, and 1 minute walk to the flatiron building down the road on the right. We found an amazing little cafe/restaurant called COSI (left out of the building then left again at end of road carry on until you see it on the left again). Lifts were always working and towels and bedding always made for when we returned from our ventures. This was the perfect hotel for me. Maybe i was lucky, or maybe this was just a fab lil undiscovered hotel that needed us to big it up. ALso Jay-zee's club (40/40club) was literally next door to us. Oh and i had an orthopoedic mattress, very snazzy i must say. All in all an AMAZING hotel - would definatly return again and again. i really dont know what all these other crazy people are on about ? rubbish no way this was hot. (not 5*, but kitsch)

Reviews.Title: “much much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: we booked our trip to new york about 8 months ago and then read reviews on trip advisor and it sounded ok.3 days before we were due to fly out we had another look and were gutted at the reviews!we read that it was a tip and a building site.we contacted the hotel and they told us that the rooms had been completed and they were doing the lobby and hall ways.we decided that we could put up with this as we weren't sleeping in the lobby.we checked in and yes there were workmen painting the halls but it didn't affect us.some mornings we had to share the lift with a pot of paint or a ladder but it was no hardship!the rooms were a good size and had been refurbished to a good standard and had all new fixtures and fittings.the bathroom also got the thumbs up from us.we were on the 9th floor but had pleanty of hot water and a powerfull shower.the staff on the desk were polite and very helpfull.the location of this hotel was great and just 10mins walk to the empire state and 20 to times square.loads of places at the end of the block to grab a coffee and to get lunch.the restaurant/take away joining the hotel looks a bit of a rough place to eat but don't judge a book by it's cover.this place you can watch your food being cooked and it was top notch.if we were coming to new york again we would definatly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location - what a bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow – great room, great location and we can’t believe what a bargain it was. We were very apprehensive about our stay at The Arlington having read the reviews on the Trip Advisor web site but we were pleasantly surprised. The reception and shared areas weren’t great but I think they have improved from other people’s reviews. The receptionist was really helpful and put us in a refurbished room as requested. The room was amazing. It was really clean and roomy, with a massive super King size bed, loads of storage, fridge, TV, safe and hairdryer. The room would easily measure up to at least a 3* equivalent. The room was serviced daily including a change of towels. The worst point would be the heat at night. We had to keep the window open and the curtains didn’t quite meeting in the middle so ear plugs and an eye mask would be advisable for light sleepers. The location is also fantastic. It is ~ 10 minutes from the Empire State Building (of which we had a great view from our room – check out our photos) and ~ 15 minutes from Times Square. There is a Subway just round the corner (good luck mastering that one – the London Underground it is not!) and loads of delis nearby for breakfast. If we came to New York again we would definitely, definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm going to try and be objective....”
Reviews.Author: pmfrench
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I suppose location. The location of the hotel is 25th Street (btw Broadway & 6th Ave). This is away from the glitz and glamour, about 9 blocks down from Empire State Building (10 min walk) and about 20 mins downtown from Time Square. It's situated by a couple of subway stops that are good for servicing the rest of the Manhattan area. I found the location fine. As for the hotel itself, I'm going to try and be objective about this as at the moment there is a major redecoration going on and this is going to be a MAJOR upset to a lot of people. The rooms themselves are small but clean with nice big double bed and shower room. Views from our room were dreadful but I don't think this would matter where you were as the location of the hotel is such that there is nothing really to look at anyway. I had no complaints about the room. However, the rest of the hotel (corridors, lobby, lifts etc) are a mess at the moment due to the work going on and there's paint and workmen everywhere (sometimes taking over the lifts making going up and down the floors a pain in the backside). The work looked as if it could be going to go on for a while though cannot say exactly for how long. Perhaps would be worth checking with your tour operator before booking. One thing I would say about the rooms and this is a bit of a pet hate of mine anyway is that they are arranged such that at the end of a corridor three doors are next to each other (forming three sides of a square if you follow me) which means noise does carry if people are hanging around outside the rooms. Also, the fire doors slam which makes a dreadful noise which can wake you up in the night/morning. Sound very easily comes into the rooms from the corridors. I was happy with it overall (though maybe I'm just not fussy) however though who perhaps are used to 3/4 star accomodation will NOT be pleased with this.

Reviews.Title: “looks like a demolition site”
Reviews.Author: AnneOsprey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Arlington 5 nights. Hotel is Under complete renovation. The foyer was full of materials rolled up carpets, sinks, tiles etc. The carpets were blocking the staircase in the foyer which was a fire hazzard and a workman was literally jumping up and down on them to fold them smaller. The two lifts available were used by the workmen who would clamber in with their buckets. The lifts were full of dust and debri as were the corriders. Someone attempted to enter our room despite it being locked from the inside and a chair and suitcase wedged. We were woken up by my daughter at 3.30 am as she discovered the door open and the chair had been pushed aside. We complained to the management who said they would investigate. The only other people with keys were their own night staff !! The number of our room was crudely stuck to the door with sticky tape. There was a photocopy of a workman operating drill stuck to the walls in the corrider and the lifts to demonstrate the extent of the work. Not worth the money. A guy turned up unannounced with a spray gun claiming to be pest control and sprayed the corners of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If it's room-by-the-hour ambience you're after, this is your place! The best thing I can say is no one broke in and cut my throat in the night (though the locks are flimsy enough that a toddler could kick the door in). This is a step up from a refigerator box on Broadway. My room had flickering fluorescent lights. The drop ceiling barely covered the bathroom ceiling. The carpets looked like trucks had been parked on them. If you have any standards at all, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: fan987
Reviews.Content: lobby (if thats what you wanna call it) smells, halls smell, rooms smell. definately not worth the money. stay at hotel qt if you wanna go cheap.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Arlington Hotel on W. 25th St is a very mixed bag. Good bargain price for NYC. Excellent location, just off 5th Ave and near bus lines, subway, small park. The rooms are clean and well serviced. The radiators are very noisy and much too hot. The staff is competent and pleasant. However, the rest of the hotel leaves much to be desired: hallways that were dusty, no place to sit when waiting in the lobby. To be fair, they were under renovation, but nevertheless, nothing was ever done to keep the halls clean, e.g. no effort made to empty the ashtrays in the halls or to sweep the floors. Hope that when they're renovated, the public spaces of the hotel will be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nina21284
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap and cheerful hotel, so we booked the Arlington after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was slightly worried as I wasn't sure it was going to be great, especially as all the rooms are smoking. However, I was wrong. It wasn't the Ritz, but it was definitely worth the £25 per night that my three friends and I paid for our family room. the foyer wasn't great, but who spend any time there! The bathroom was great, the shower was powerful, although some larger towells wouldn't have gone amiss. Also, don't forget your hairdryer. The room, if a little old fashioned, was clean, although very hot at night. There was an electronic safe in the room and the door had a deadbolt. The hotel is in an excellent location and as it is under refurbishment at the moment, I would quite possibly stay there again. As for the smell of smoke, it was barely noticeable. Thank you Arlington for a great New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Arlington Hotel when I walked into the foyet was not too good. The foyet looked dirty and old fashioned and there were workmen coming in and out of the lifts. The staff were friendly enough though and then we made our way to our room. I had read reviews about the Arlington before I booked so I was expecting a cramped box room. But to my suprise it was a little bit bigger than I expected. There was a safe and a fridge in the room and the bathroom was almost brand new. Cleanliness, safety and peace & quiet were all I really wanted from my room\hotel and that is exactly what I got with The Arlington. (I discovered that the previously mentioned workmen were making improvements on the hotel - I must say that I was never disturbed by them once during my stay!) During my weeks stay I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a safe enough place with deli's, coffee houses, bars, a pharmacy, subway stations, shops (ladies mile) etc all within 2 mins walk. For those people who just want a hotel to come back to after a hards days shopping, site seeing etc The Arlington is ideal. Great location, neat and tidy clean rooms and friendly staff. I would definitely stay there again on my return to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: cSc0911
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a December business convention. The hotel is in a good location near a couple subway lines. There's a nice club just steps away from the main entrance. Several 24hour deli's located nearby. Decent neighborhood. Hotel is not handicap accessible as it only has stairs at the main entrance. Once inside, there are elevators available. One of the first things I noticed going up to the room is that the emergency exit sign was just hanging by the cords. At least it was lit up :) The room was quite large by Manhattan standards but the carpet was quite dirty with bits and pieces of trash strewn about in both rooms. There was also noticable dust constantly floating around the room. The windows did not stop the freezing cold air, but the noisy radiator took care of that problem. Bathroom was quite clean and fresh towels were available. Bed had clean linens. Most of the handles on the dresser were missing or broken. *** Hints for future hotel guests *** 1. Bring slippers, my feet were almost black after taking a shower and just walking around the room. 2. Room smelled a little like cleaning fluid, so bring scented candles if you want. 3. Bring earplugs for wintertime. The constant rattling and gurgling of the radiator would keep light sleepers up. 4. Remind the front desk to keep the exit stairwell door clear of luggage carts. One night, I came down the stairs to find the cart blocking the door and had to reach around the door and slide the cart out of the way. This is one of two emergency exit routes. If I was to return and pay on my own, I'd probably look into staying here again since it is quite cost-effective :) However, I'd keep an eye out for slightly nicer accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty towers but great location”
Reviews.Author: cazpiece
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Arlington was interesting. First time to New York so for the price we paid £220 for 3 nights we didn't expect the Ritz. What we did get was a great view of the Empire State Building from our room, clean towels daily, room service daily and a radiator that leaked scalding hot water which we were told was normal!! This hotel has all the basics you need for a stay in New York but is missing the touches that would have made it better such as coffee facilities in the room. The location is great whether you walk nearly everywhere as we did or want to get the tube. Maybe if you use this hotel ask for a renovated room as I assume they will be of a better standard.

Reviews.Title: “no luxuries just the necesseties”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the arlington over thanksgiving for 6 days, the hotel was okay not the best & certainly not the worst, was in a good location few blocks from empire state building 5 minutes walking distance & virtually around the corner is the yellow subway line which goes up and down manhatten, the hotel itself is having some renovation done but to no disruption to guests, the rooms are fairly big and kept clean, you have no wardrobe but a clothes rail on which you can hang your garments, beds were made everyday and towels replaced, only had one problem with not being able to turn down heating but this was soon resolved when maintenance was contacted. Personally this was a great base for my holiday as it was just used to basically sleep & shower the rest of the time was out shopping and sightseeing enjoying new york for what it is, i would recommend this hotel no luxuries just the necesseties. Enjoy your holiday !! UZMA :-)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Arlington with my wife. Reserved rooms trough Travelnow for 139+taxes and fees so three nites were 500 USD altogether. Although for this price everywhere else in the world you expect a super great room in NYC we were cautious and hoped only for a clean room to sleep in. IT was much better than we hoped for, our room 1001 was completely renovated with 30 some channel tv an okay sized room and an extremely clean and comfortable ...i would say downright perfect bathrooom. The bed was comfy, the towels were really thin but oh well. The staff unlike mentioned before were not all that bad. The girl and the younger guy and middle aged guy were very nice..only the older one was grumpy looking. Overall they were efficient and friendly enough. The view from our room as you see the picture was probably the worst one can wish for, but personally I prefer a cozy and clean place rather than a dirty with great view..because that is about the choice you have in New York except if you are willing to pay 500 and up a night. The Arlington is in a very good neighbourhood I would say 5 minutes to ES Building and two minutes to the Subway and Flatiron Building. In the neighbourhoods there are plenty of places for breakfast for under two dollars. If you are a power tourist you should get the new york pass and see as much as possible. Buy the weekly or daily metropass for 24 and 7 dollars they re well worth it if you plan to see a lot. The Arlington by the way is under construction and soon all the rooms will be nice, but for now I think only the top couple floors are in good condition. If you get good price I would definatly recommend to stay there. You wont be sorry. NYC is just magical.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again if Only”
Reviews.Author: johndeff
Reviews.Content: On the Plus side Great location for a Hotel in Manhatten close to subway and on Orange and Yellow line on Broadway. Room was way larger than the average Manhatten Hotel Room was Spotless and Maid service was good even though they forgot to make the bed one day. Safe and fridge in the room were major bonused for us as overseas travellers with money and passport security a must. 2 excellent breakfast / lunch diners on Brodway around the corner Irish pub on broadway again on 5th ?avenue around the corner.(very average pub but nice to get a night cap after slogging around NY) Very helpful concierge not sure of her name helped us with any questions we had. On the Downside Room on the 11 floor while quiet was was too hot to sleep with the air conditioning way too loud to sleep. Bed requested was a king actual size a double on wheels which was way too soft to be comfortable. Leaving luggage in storage be it for 2-3 hours cost us $1.50 per bag.Very tight. Hotel staff were indifferent and never seemed very welcoming or friendly. TV reception was poor and basic. Beware the first impression of th Hotel is very dirty BUT they are in the middle of renovations.If you access the Hotel from 6th Avenue the area does not look too friendly but from Broadway its OK. Generally OK hotel but I wouldn't recommend it for comfort andhospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: katie_pops
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying in the Arlington Hotel and I found it good for the price. The rooms are basic but reasonably clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was a very necessary plus and the mini-fridge and safe were also very useful extras. However i found the lifts extremely slow and you would probably be faster crawling up the stairs, so request a room on one the lower floors so that you could maybe take the stairs instead (we were on 9! not possible to use the stairs daily) Some other people that I knew that were staying there at the same time had a room to the front on the third floor, this proved extremely noisy on a saturday night as there is a nightclub a few doors up. It is in a reasonably safe area but I would recommend walking uptown on either 5th or 6th Ave instead of Broadway as we found a section of Broadway on the way to Times Square to be quite threatening. If you are looking for somewhere to put your head down after you shop/sightsee and you are on a budget and don't fancy sharing a bathroom then I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for the practical traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful value. If you want a gym, a spa, and a bell-boy to serve you dinner, then forget about it. This hotel was great! It had air-conditioning, a mini-fridge, and a safe to store your valuables. Ice is available downstairs. Room service comes in everyday and cleans. After reading other reviews, I only expected the worst, but really, I found the Arlington to be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A place is OK, but don't expect wonders”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've spent 5 nights at this hotel - from 30th of July till 5th of August 2005. After reading reviews on that site I did expect a much worse place. But! Location is great!One block from Flatiron building, 7 minute walk to Empire State Building an 14 moinutes walk to Times square - actually I never used a subway or taxi since all the places of interest for me were easyly acessible by foot. Hotel itself looks worn out, with corridors requiring renovation, but rooms were clean, hot water was available, and a/c did a nice job during the very hot days in August. Towls are thin indeed, but there are four of them for twin room changed daily. Hotel is value for money, it's not that easy to find something on Manhatten in the price category. My only advise woould be - don't even attempt to use "high speed internet access" terminal in the lobby, since it buys you 5 mins for 1 dollar, but for the whole of these 5 mins you're just waiting for the system to load - and it hangs most of the time. In overall, I recommend this hotel for budget travellers, who are not expecting a 5 star treatment in 2 star hotel. But if you come there only to sleep - it's a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “cheap 'n quiet”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBelgium
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 10 days. It's an ok hotel but don't expect ANY luxury. Very basic rooms, the bed was made every day and the room was clean (if you didn't look in the corners) The location is excellent, and very quiet. The staff on the contrary was very UNfriendly, but that didn't bother me. Cheap hotel, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay At The Arlington It was great the rooms were cleaned every day beds where made with clean sheets the staff where very helpful aswell if you need information go to the desk i needed songs for my mp3 player and the staff directed me to my nearest internet cafe theres a brilliant view of the hotel from the top of the empire state building i thought it was fantastic that you could see the hotel from the empire state building

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - perfect for the traveller”
Reviews.Author: AlanEssex
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect if you are visiting New York and don't want to pay extortionate (more than £100 a night!) prices. The front desk were helpful. They were opened when we arrived VERY late and arranged a private car to pick us up on our return journey VERY early in the morning. Our room was clean with fully funtional amenities, if a little old fashioned in decoration. The place probably needs a re-vamp, but this is par for the course in New York unless you stay at The Trump Plaza! Location is perfect. A 10 minute walk to Empire State Building/Times Square. I would advise using the Subway however. Buy a weekly ticket for about $17 gets real value as it costs you $1 per journey otherwise. The hotel certainly compares favourably to others, which, in fairness do look run down. Do not expect the Ritz, but an ideal base for a stay in New York. New York hotels are expensive. We paid about £80 per night and found this value for money in comparison to others which charge in excess of £100 for similar if not worse conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but probably could do better if you looked around”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: (I actually used this hotel twice, in Sept 2000 and Mar 2002, so this review applies to both visits, unless indicated). Getting to your room involved either a miniscule, slow, crowded elevator, or climbing a claustrophobic stairway. (Most of the time I took the stairs, as doing so was much faster than waiting for the elevator). The room was tiny, but I kind of expected that to some extent. The view was of the adjacent building, but one doesn't go to a hotel like this for the view. TV reception (which seemed to be over the air, not cable?) was fuzzy. The phone required a deposit, even for local calls (and they were expensive). My cell phone didn't work inside the building, so I had to step outside each time I needed to make a call. The bathroom was ok, if a bit musty. However, in 2002, I noticed some flaking wall material near the radiator. This was unnerving, as visions of asbestos danced in my head.... In 2000, there was a little breakfast room, and upon check-in, customers were given vouchers good for breakfast. After one breakfast dealing with low-quality food and snotty staff, I decided to have my breakfast elsewhere. This facility had closed entirely when I went back in 2002; I don't know if they've ever reopened it. (There's a adjacent Chinese restaraunt that may be associated with this hotel, but I didn't try it). The immediate neighborhood is fine, (on 25th between 5th and 6th Aves) is fine, but somewhat dim after dark. You're not too far away from busier streets (and 24-hour delis) though....The subway is just a block south, and plenty of buses and cabs ply 5th and 6th ave. The hotel will also call a car service for you, if you need to get to the airports. All in all, probably not the worst place, but you can probably do better, with careful searching of the travel sites, discussion groups, and, of course, Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: March 10th -17th. After booking my holiday to stay at the Carter Hotel, a few weeks later the travel agent advised me to change to the Arlington because of all the bad reports, and after seeing the Hotel Carter in the flesh, I am grateful. This was my first time in New York. I went over by myself to fulfil an ambition of mine - to visit this fantastic city. I couldn't believe the location of the hotel, it was great, right beside the junction of 5th & Broadway and next to the Flat Iron Building. I enjoy antiques and got a further surprise, when I found that the street was full of antique shops and home to a flea market at the weekend, where I got some great bargains. The street does look a bit rough, but I never had a problem with anyone. The hotel has good facilities for its price. My room was clean, and kept clean every day by the cleaners. It had a shower with hot water, a large comfortable bed and a TV with about 20 stations. I know we don't go on holiday to watch TV but its good if you don't want to be out at night. The room also had an electronic safe. The view from the window was a brick wall, I laughed when I looked out and thought it was quite novel after seeing so many movies featuring the city. It's all part of the experience. In the reception, there are vendors, phones and a computer offering internet access, which was great for communicating with people back home. The staff were very helpful and friendly - I bought a phone card at the Empire State and couldn't get it to work right, asked the receptionist at Arlington for help and she phoned the number and put me through free of charge. The card wasn't working because I forgot to skip the "0" at the start of the area code, there's a handy tip! There is also a Chinese restaurant on the ground floor, I never ate there, so can't tell you what the food's like. Just around the corner is a small grocery shop which offers a good selection of hot and cold snacks. I usually went there in the morning for breakfast on the move and then on to McDonalds, Burger King and loads of sandwich bars at night. There is a nice restaurant at the Rockefeller centre, but if you want to eat there, remember and pack for the dress code. I never took a taxi or the subway anywhere except to and from the airport. I just liked to walk from place to place and take in as much of the city as possible. Add to that, they drive like maniacs, practically every car has a dent! The hotel is only a short walk from the Empire State Building, which offers stunning views of the city and is close to many points of interest. Overall, I thought the hotel was great. The decor was out of date but who cares? Your here to admire and enjoy the city, not the confines of your hotel. It it does the job especially for someone like me on a budget. I can't understand all the negative comments other people have made. The staff were friendly, the room comfortable and clean, great location and cheap - What more do you want? If you have the money, then spend it on a better hotel rather than be a stooge. You get what you pay for. If -no- WHEN I go back to New York, I'll be staying here again for sure! The attached photo is a view from the top of the Empire State looking towards downtown Manhattan. I have pinpointed where the hotel is. You can see hotel from the ESB. The hotel is just in front and to the left of the green church roof.

Reviews.Title: “Low-Rate Smelly Rat Trap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a good value---actually a DANK dismal, depressing place on a block which matches it. I paid $119 for one nite--never again. The late nite and a.m. Front desk staff (dressed very casually) were polite, but my stay was brief. I can see why another reviewer could not get a customer satisfaction survey. The owner should hide under his desk in a fetal position rather than take the likely bad feedback. MY REVIEW: Where do I start? OK--SLEAZE bag decor, narrow, ugly corridors and multiple twists and fire doors to get to your equally ugly room (Bathroom was clean with hot water). Entire place looks unkept. TV is basic, few stations, poor reception--no cable noted. Locks poor--I put a chair against the door. Carpets look like old indoor-outdoor style. THE WORST PART? My window looked out on HELL--a clump of filthy rags hanging on barbed-wire, backed by a brick wall of filthy windows in the adjoining building's window. The front desk acted like this was a surprise to them. UGH. There are far toooo many hotels in NYC to go this route. The Milford, for instance, may have small rooms, but the overall experience is TONS better and the neighborhood superior.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but cool”
Reviews.Author: pdxchris4633
Reviews.Content: May 2-5. After reading the previous posts here about the Arlington Hotel, I wasn’t sure what to expect. Upon arrival I laughed to myself as I, like the other reviewers, immediately noticed the slight smell of cigarette smoke and general mustiness. My first impression of the room was “kinda dumpy”, but after awhile, the place began to grow on me. The room was clean as was the bathroom. No bugs or critters of any kind to be found. The shower pressure was great and plenty of hot water. Yeah, the towels were thin, but they gave us as many as we wanted. There was a safe in the room as well as a fridge, TV, phone, AC and dresser. (if you want a pen – bring one! No pens/paper in room) Vending machines were in the lobby (drink, snack, internet, ATM) No ice machine on premises. That would have been nice. We were on the inside side with the closed-in breezeway. At first I was bummed that we had no view, but soon realized that it was much quieter than the streetside in the city that truly never sleeps. My biggest complaint was the size of the beds. I was there with a friend and we had 2 twin beds, which are about 5’10” long. I am 6’3, my friend, 6’5. The location is great… Only 2 blocks (about a 2 minute walk) to the subways. Call the hotel directly for room rates before booking with an internet site. Their rack rate was $10/night cheaper than I paid on hotels.com. All in all, if you are looking for a clean place without any hassles, this property was well worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “what do you want for the price”
Reviews.Author: markstuds
Reviews.Content: come on give the hotel a break,if you want a classy hotel with room service,bell boys,and fancy dinners and some one to wipe your bottom go some where else,its new york why do you want to spend time in the hotel anyway.i found it just what i needed a place to crash for four nights and in a good area as well quite central to everywhere and i thought the staff were great they said hello and good morning what you wanting an invite for dinner.if you don't want much for the the money you paid try it out i thought it were greeeeaaatttt.new york is amazing and it was my first time there by the way have a great time you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 wonderful days in New York and having booked a quad room last September at the Arlington we were very pleased to find our budget accomodation was warm, clean had very comfy beds and was in the best location for sight seeing. No its not very appealing to look at but as you are out all day and just need some where to sleep its absolutely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Have relalistic expectations and this hotel is OK :-)”
Reviews.Author: davenottm
Reviews.Content: The Arlington is actually a perfectly sound budget hotel which I would be happy to recommend to anyone looking for budget accomodation in NYC. What you have to be prepared to accept is the inevitable shortcomings of budget accomodation. This was our first trip to NYC from the UK. Upon arrival the exterior of the hotel is uninspiring, although the reception staff were courteous and polite throughout. Probably the most distressing time was the initial journey to the room. Hallways and corridors ARE rather tired and shabby and even the rooms appear low rent at first sight. What we soon relaised was that this WAS budget accomodation, but that important things were there. The rooms were clean and serviced daily, there was a safe in the room, and the staff were friendly. I would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, done the job...”
Reviews.Author: KT1978UK
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NY and found this hotel to be ideal for what we wanted. Due to the fact we were only looking for a room with a bathroom this was ideal. I agree with an earlier post in that the corridors did smell odd but was more then happy with our room which was clean and perfect for our stay. Good location for sightseeing giving you oppurtunity to easily reach downtown or the Times Square areas easily by foot or Subway. An absolute must when visiting NY is a visit to Cafe Wha (bar/club) on Macdougall Street, Greenwich on a wednesday or Sunday when the resident band play who are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in September 2004 for a weekend trip in February 2005. Made it clear that we wanted a TWIN room (just me and my 15 year old son going). When we arrived, no twin room available. I wasn't impressed, especially as I'd booked so far in advance AND already paid. Eventually we were offered a fold-up bed. To be fair, they brought it up to our room straight away. The room was at the back of the hotel so fairly quiet. The hotel in general could do with some love and attention but it's clean. We had to ask for extra blankets as the room was very cold, but we weren't in it for long. At least the shower was hot! Good location although for the money I'd rather go to the Newton (stayed there last year) 2528 Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, bad staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel from 21st feb-27feb 2005. As soon as we checked in we encountered a problem. The man behind reception obviously had better things to be doing, than doing his job. He was rude and couln't wait to get rid of us. We got into our room and found the same problem as, Boston Dec 2004 did, the room was so hot, we had all windows open at all times. However the room was clean and tidy. When we travel we like to do our own thing, however some things arose where we asked the staff for some help, ie airport transfers which we paid 52 dollars for. We booked the time of the transfer with the staff behind reception for 4.30PM to go to the airport. At 4.30 am we were woken from our sleep, and being rudely asked why we were not downstairs! An honest mistake, maybe??? Our receipt stated that we were to be picked up at PM. The problem was how badly we were treated. We later went downstairs to confirm that our booking was still confirmed for the afternoon, again this was to much of an effort for the staff and again were treated badly by the staff. I would like to say that it was only one staff member that was rude, however they were ALL rude, unprofessional, and unwilling to help us. Overall, we had a clean room in a hotel with a good location. However if you would like to be treated with respect DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you ever get the chance to go to NYC DO NOT stay in the Arlington Hotel . We stayed there unfortunately as we had been appointed by a travel agents and did not have much choice. The reception is filthy and has a chinese restaraunt attached which is basically a 'down and out' drop in centre!! The rooms are smelly dingy and the bedding had hairs in it. I was forced to buy my own bedding and pillows as I couldn't bring myself to sleep on the hotels sheets. We stayed for 3 nights and eventually checked out as the final straw were mice running around in the ceiling!!!!!!!!!!! Our room door was tried for entry one night and because we were in we didn't get robbed but we basically felt vulnerable and unsafe at all times in this Hotel. The smell on the corridor was so bad( like body odour) that we had to spray air freshner so that it did not seep into our room. We have travelled to New York on numerous occassions and have never stayed in such a dump in our lives. Whatever you do do not inflict a stay at the Arlington on yourself you will truly regret it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints about this hotel and would definitely stay there again. For the price you pay you'd be a fool to expect a spacious, pristinely decorated room with top of the range gadgets. It's clean (maid service daily), it's warm, there's plenty of hot water and the staff are competent and accommodating. Then there's the location: Less than 15 minute walk to the Empire State Building and a very pleasant 30 minute walk to Times Square. If money is an issue then this is the hotel for you. If it isn't then enjoy your limo to the luxury 5 star hotel of your choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel....Low Prices”
Reviews.Author: galvestonfan
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from reviews on this website. We did our homework and didn't expect much more than a place to sleep and shower. We were not disappointed in the least. Staff was more than helpful and kind. If you are budget minded...this is your hotel. We are 4 females and never felt unsafe in the area or the hotel. Kudos to staff member Patricia for all her help.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arlington for 3 nights during july. The room was clean and the beds were comfortably. The bathroom although small was very clean, the shower worked well and was always hot. We had a room at the back so it was very quite although the veiw out of the window was of a fire esacpe. The staff were helpful, we twice had a problem with our safe and both times it was sorted out straight away. This hotel is in a good location and the subway is only two blocks away. If your in new york to see the sights and not to sit in your hotel room then for the price this hotel is excellent, i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Arlington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Arlington for 5 nights after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I would recommend the Arlington for budget-minded travellers, but there are some things to be aware of. First, make sure you book a room with a private bathroom - we had one, but were around the corner from the shared bathroom and the smell was quite something! Our room was small and there were virtually no amenities (not even Kleenex!), but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. For me, this was the most important consideration. However, there is a nightclub a couple of doors down from the hotel, and while it wasn't a problem during the week, on Friday and Saturday night, the noise kept us up most of the night (till after 4:00). On the upside, it's a great central location, right near Gramercy, walkable to Washington Square Park and the Village, Madison Square Park is right there, and there are some very good restaurants in nearby Gramercy. Just watch out for that nightclub...

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from a weekend at the Arlington and agree with the others reviewers - it is basic and clean and it's selling point is it's fabulous location between 5th and 6th avenues on west 25th street. It's right by 23rd street subway station and there are good bus routes on 5th ave (for downtown) and 6th ave (for uptotwn). less than 10 blocks away is the Empire State Building. A room at the back of the hotel is quieter and there is plenty of hot water for showers. As other posters have pointed out, you don't gop to NYC to spend your days in a hotel... A word of warning: don't go to the Rogue Bar on 6th Avenue and 24th -it's a rip-off - over 7$ for a glass of wine and 7$ for a beer - you can do better!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Chelsea
HotelInfo.Address: 18 West 25th Street, at 5th Avenue, New York City, NY 10010
